GT.content: readability of text structured by unreadability of secret, narrator in situation analogous to reader; crypt gives to be read, eternally unreadable
GT.linkedContent: readability of text structured by unreadability of secret, narrator in situation analogous to reader; crypt gives to be read, eternally unreadable

BL.content: unreadability of text: impossibility of acceding to its proper significance
BL.linkedContent: unreadability of text: impossibility of acceding to its proper significance

LOBL.content: l’arrêt de mort, “ingenious” decision, one of those that are made (s’arrêtent) only in a language, escape signature by any “I”, untranslatable, decision is unreadable > unreadability does not arrest reading in face of opaque surface, it starts reading, writing, translating again
LOBL.linkedContent: l’arrêt de mort, “ingenious” decision, one of those that are made (s’arrêtent) only in a language, escape signature by any “I”, untranslatable, decision is unreadable > unreadability does not arrest reading in face of opaque surface, it starts reading, writing, translating again

LOBL.content: unreadable not opposite of readable but the ridge (arête) that sets in motion
LOBL.linkedContent: unreadable not opposite of readable but the ridge (arête) that sets in motion

LOBL.content: absolute crypt [heart] is unreadability—yet calls for infinite finite analysis, infinite-finite reada-translata-bility
LOBL.linkedContent: absolute crypt [heart] is unreadability—yet calls for infinite finite analysis, infinite-finite reada-translata-bility

LOBL.content: in Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, 2 women, 2 voices w/out voice, tele-phone each other: “come” > how do we read this unreadable hymen? it takes place as unreadable, from bottom of crypt in which it remains > it will have taken place where it remains: that’s the proof
LOBL.linkedContent: in Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, 2 women, 2 voices w/out voice, tele-phone each other: “come” > how do we read this unreadable hymen? it takes place as unreadable, from bottom of crypt in which it remains > it will have taken place where it remains: that’s the proof

MPM.content: we come to ourselves through memory of possible mourning, knowledge older than ourselves, de Man might say: unreadability of mourning
MPM.linkedContent: we come to ourselves through memory of possible mourning, knowledge older than ourselves, de Man might say: unreadability of mourning

MPM.content: mimetic interiorization not just fictive, is origin of fiction, takes place in a body, makes place for body, soul, “ours” > death constitutes and makes manifest limits of me, us, obliged to harbor something greater than us w/in us
MPM.linkedContent: mimetic interiorization not just fictive, is origin of fiction, takes place in a body, makes place for body, soul, “ours” > death constitutes and makes manifest limits of me, us, obliged to harbor something greater than us w/in us

MPM.content: for de Man, “allegory of unreadability”: when performative cannot be distinguished from constative, all the while remaining irreducible
MPM.linkedContent: for de Man, “allegory of unreadability”: when performative cannot be distinguished from constative, all the while remaining irreducible

VM.content: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”
VM.linkedContent: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”

OH.content: that which is not mass-produced is unreadable
OH.linkedContent: that which is not mass-produced is unreadable

T.content: tympanum, Dionysianism, Ariadne’s Thread, labyrinth: the bloodiness of a disseminated writing violates embouchure of philosophy, contact w/ another code, a unique event, unreadable as such, inaudible, btwn earth & sea, w/out signature [Bataille]
T.linkedContent: tympanum, Dionysianism, Ariadne’s Thread, labyrinth: the bloodiness of a disseminated writing violates embouchure of philosophy, contact w/ another code, a unique event, unreadable as such, inaudible, btwn earth & sea, w/out signature [Bataille]

SH.content: unreadable is readable as unreadable, shibboleth transmitted to a few during finite time of incineration, heart to heart, mouth to ear, hand to hand, still universal by right (legible, coded, troped) > madness of fire: consumes a date from w/in > renders ash from 1st moment
SH.linkedContent: unreadable is readable as unreadable, shibboleth transmitted to a few during finite time of incineration, heart to heart, mouth to ear, hand to hand, still universal by right (legible, coded, troped) > madness of fire: consumes a date from w/in > renders ash from 1st moment

SH.content: “Sie setzt / Wundgelesens über (it carries across / the wound-read)”: [circumcision in the reading] “reader-gatherer” > wound offers itself to be read—not readable, but a part of reading
SH.linkedContent: “Sie setzt / Wundgelesens über (it carries across / the wound-read)”: [circumcision in the reading] “reader-gatherer” > wound offers itself to be read—not readable, but a part of reading

DS.content: “themes” run aground (échoue) at edge lesser & greater than theme, where “there is” a text is made a possibility, a readability w/out signified (fright’s reflex declares: unreadable)
DS.linkedContent: “themes” run aground (échoue) at edge lesser & greater than theme, where “there is” a text is made a possibility, a readability w/out signified (fright’s reflex declares: unreadable)

PS.content: Artaud: “I am writing for illiterates” > not to erase letter but to subordinate it to incidence of illegibility
PS.linkedContent: Artaud: “I am writing for illiterates” > not to erase letter but to subordinate it to incidence of illegibility

PS.content: Artaud seeks a depth of illegibility
PS.linkedContent: Artaud seeks a depth of illegibility

EJQB.content: born only by approaching book, die only by failing (échouant) in sight of book > toujours la rive impassible du livre est d’abord
EJQB.linkedContent: born only by approaching book, die only by failing (échouant) in sight of book > toujours la rive impassible du livre est d’abord

EJQB.content: book as epoch of Being (epoch coming to and end, the glow of Being in agony, a multiplication of the end, “garrulous and tenacious hypermnesia of certain moribunds,” books about the dead book)
EJQB.linkedContent: book as epoch of Being (epoch coming to and end, the glow of Being in agony, a multiplication of the end, “garrulous and tenacious hypermnesia of certain moribunds,” books about the dead book)

EJQB.content: Being radically outside book, its letter > Being reveals itself only in illegibility (illisibilité)
EJQB.linkedContent: Being radically outside book, its letter > Being reveals itself only in illegibility (illisibilité)

EJQB.content: radical illisibilité belongs to the book, very possibility of it > such illegibility not an accomplice of lost (sought after) legibility, of a page not yet cut from divine encyclopedia
EJQB.linkedContent: radical illisibilité belongs to the book, very possibility of it > such illegibility not an accomplice of lost (sought after) legibility, of a page not yet cut from divine encyclopedia

D.content: X not an unknown but chiasmus, a text that is unreadable because only readable > Numbers undecipherable because you imposed encryption on them by trying to decipher them
D.linkedContent: X not an unknown but chiasmus, a text that is unreadable because only readable > Numbers undecipherable because you imposed encryption on them by trying to decipher them

ATM.content: the Relation to the Other is not a phenomenal monstration, and is not readable w/in the uncertainty of rigorous limits of a lexicon, language, semiotics, logic, etc.
ATM.linkedContent: the Relation to the Other is not a phenomenal monstration, and is not readable w/in the uncertainty of rigorous limits of a lexicon, language, semiotics, logic, etc.

SPEC.content: the unanalyzed remainder of an unconscious remains [re: Freud’s autobiographical, writing], Derrida: “je parie” that it will be transmitted blindly by all who “return to Freud”: remainder that works the scene is illegible—i.e., restance, yet the only urgency of what reste à faire
SPEC.linkedContent: the unanalyzed remainder of an unconscious remains [re: Freud’s autobiographical, writing], Derrida: “je parie” that it will be transmitted blindly by all who “return to Freud”: remainder that works the scene is illegible—i.e., restance, yet the only urgency of what reste à faire

SPEC.content: [re: repetition before PP or collaborates w/ PP] the 2 repetitions (2 logics) as constitutive duplicity, double bind
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: repetition before PP or collaborates w/ PP] the 2 repetitions (2 logics) as constitutive duplicity, double bind

SPEC.content: if there’s any chance of reading illegible text as illegible: must take incalculable double bind (bande) of PP into account
SPEC.linkedContent: if there’s any chance of reading illegible text as illegible: must take incalculable double bind (bande) of PP into account
